question.text: Which of the following is not applicable to the given figure ?

options.text: This process occurs when light ofwavelengths beyond 680 nm are available forexcitation.
This process results only in the synthesis of ATP not of NADPH + H<sup>+</sup>
This process requires two molecules of H<sub>2</sub>O to release one O<sub>2</sub>
This process occurs in the thylakoid which lack NADP reductase enzyme

solution.text: When only PS I is functional, the electron is circulated within the photosystem and the phosphorylation occurs due to cyclic flow of electrons. A possible location where this could be happening is in the stroma lamellae. While the membrane or lamellae of the grana have both PS I and PS II the stroma lamellae membranes lack PS II as well as NADP reductase enzyme. The excited electron does not pass on to NADP<sup>+</sup> but is cycled back to the PS I complex through the electron transport chain. The cyclic flow hence results only in the synthesis of ATP, but not of NADPH + H<sup>+</sup>. Cyclic photophosphorylation also occurs when only light of wavelengths beyond 680 nm are available for excitation.
